elements.title: Revenue Recognition

data.value: Revenue is recognized upon conclusion that a contract with a customer exists, when the contract is legally enforceable and criteria such as collectability are met.
Assessment includes the customer's credit worthiness, current financial position, historical payment patterns, industry economic conditions, and political/economic stability of the customer's region.

Includes SaaS based revenue management platform arrangements, managed services, SaaS payments platform arrangements, software license and service arrangements, professional services, and bundled service arrangements.

Determination of revenue involves identifying performance obligations, estimating transaction price (including variable consideration), allocating stand-alone selling prices, and using hours-based methods for certain contracts. Changes in estimates and judgment significantly affect the timing and amount of revenue recognized.

Contracts may be modified via amendments, change requests, or statements of work, which require complex accounting judgments to determine whether modifications are treated as separate contracts or parts of the existing contract.
The significant judgments in estimating revenue recognition can materially affect the reported revenue, including assessments of whether an arrangement is conducted on a gross or net revenue basis.
